com.noctarius.borabora.spi.query.optimizer

Interface QueryOptimizer


  • public interface QueryOptimizer
    The QueryOptimizer interface defines a single optimizer strategy. An optimizer is expected to apply zero or more optimizations to the provided PipelineStage. Since the pipeline is immutable, optimizations must create a new pipeline using the provided PipelineStageFactory instance.

    Before the optimize(PipelineStage, PipelineStageFactory) method is called the optimizer is asked if the actual pipeline type is actually optimizable given the optimizer implementation. If an optimizer cannot handle a specific type, or can only handle a specific type handles(PipelineStage) should be overridden accordingly.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean handles(PipelineStage rooPipelineStage)
      Returns true if the optimizer can handle the given type of PipelineStage, otherwise it is expected to return false.
      PipelineStage optimize(PipelineStage rootPipelineStage, PipelineStageFactory pipelineStageFactory)
      Optimizes the given PipelineStage instance (pipelineStage).

    • Method Detail

      • handles

        default boolean handles(PipelineStage rooPipelineStage)
        Returns true if the optimizer can handle the given type of PipelineStage, otherwise it is expected to return false.
        Parameters:
        rooPipelineStage - the PipelineStage to optimize
        Returns:
        true if the PipelineStage can be optimized, otherwise false

      • optimize

        PipelineStage optimize(PipelineStage rootPipelineStage,
                       PipelineStageFactory pipelineStageFactory)
        Optimizes the given PipelineStage instance (pipelineStage). To create a new pipeline, the provided PipelineStageFactory is expected to be used.
        Parameters:
        rootPipelineStage - the PipelineStage to optimize
        pipelineStageFactory - the factory to create new PipelineStage instances
        Returns:
        the optimized PipelineStage
